intro: Tridactyle truncatiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leafed tridactyle, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and slightly hairy. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink in color. It is native to parts of tropical Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
